text: Elections were held in Slovakia's eight self-governing regions on 14 November 2009. Six of the regional presidencies were won by centre-left Direction – Social Democracy (Smer), with one being won by Smer's national conservative allies, the People's Party – Movement for a Democratic Slovakia (ĽS-HZDS). Bratislava was won by the centre-right Slovak Democratic and Christian Union – Democratic Party, having previously been held by ĽS-HZDS-backed Vladimír Bajan ==Results== ===Presidencies=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! title: 2009 Slovak regional elections
